TypeSignature.Value: public delegate void SerialDataReceivedEventHandler(object sender, SerialDataReceivedEventArgs e);
.class public auto ansi sealed SerialDataReceivedEventHandler extends System.MulticastDelegate
Public Delegate Sub SerialDataReceivedEventHandler(sender As Object, e As SerialDataReceivedEventArgs)
public delegate void SerialDataReceivedEventHandler(System::Object ^ sender, SerialDataReceivedEventArgs ^ e);
type SerialDataReceivedEventHandler = delegate of obj * SerialDataReceivedEventArgs -> unit

Docs.param: The sender of the event, which is the object.
A object that contains the event data.
Docs.summary: Represents the method that will handle the event of a object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks When you create a <xref:System.IO.Ports.SerialDataReceivedEventHandler> delegate, you identify the method that will handle the event. To associate the event with your event handler, add an instance of the delegate to the event. The event handler is called whenever the event occurs, unless you remove the delegate. For more information about event-handler delegates, see [Handling and Raising Events](~/docs/standard/events/index.md).
